bug.author: S-aiueo32
bug.summary: FileNotFoundError occurs when I load pretrained model
bug.description:
Hi, I'm using PyTorch+TRAINS with single calling on the top of codes. I load pretrained model manually with following code: state_dict = torch.load( path, # pathlib.Path map_location=lambda storage, loc: storage ) Then, TRAINS make unexpected behavior like below: <denchmark-code> File "/home/ubuntu/work/xxxx/xxxx/xxxx.py", line 50, in __init__ map_location=lambda storage, loc: storage File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/torch/lib/python3.6/site-packages/trains/binding/frameworks/__init__.py", line 25, in _inner_patch raise ex File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/torch/lib/python3.6/site-packages/trains/binding/frameworks/__init__.py", line 23, in _inner_patch ret = patched_fn(original_fn, *args, **kwargs) File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/torch/lib/python3.6/site-packages/trains/binding/frameworks/pytorch_bind.py", line 92, in _load model = original_fn(filename or f, *args, **kwargs) File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/torch/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 382, in load f = open(f, 'rb') FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'xxxx.pth' </denchmark-code>
It seems TRAINS automatically detects something and tries to load pth file with a wrong path. Please give some descriptions about this behavior? As I don't currently want any more functionality, I want to make it off if I can.

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/S-aiueo32>@S-aiueo32</denchmark-link> , I just reproduced the bug. The bug is lack of support for pathlib.path object. It will be fixed for next RC version. Meanwhile you can use string: <denchmark-code>state_dict = torch.load( path.as_posix(), # pathlib.Path map_location=lambda storage, loc: storage ) </denchmark-code>
Let me know if it solved the problem
ðŸŽ‰ We fixed the bug, it should now work with your original code (pathlib.Path) You can test it with: pip install trains==0.10.5rc0
